About

AHWD is the freelance web development practice of Alex Harris.

Services

Research.

Your website is not the first website, and there is much to be learned from

Content.

High quality, well organized content is the foundation of a successful website. I can help you organize your content into a clear “information architecture” that will allow your users to easily find whatever they are looking for.

Design.

Good design makes a project shine, whether it is a new logo and identity, just the right font, or a comprehensive design system. Some design work I can do myself, sometimes it makes more sense to partner with a dedicated designer (or maybe you already have one in mind!).

Development.

I write code and build sites with an eye towards simplicity, usability and maintainability over the long term. Ideally, you could fire me and a new developer could come in and easily understand what I have built and how to continue with the work.

Support.

Many smaller organizations often don't have the expertise or resources to maintenance on their own after launch. I provide ongoing as-needed support to many clients.

About Me

Hello, I'm Alex. I have been making websites professionally for over 10 years, and have a wide variety of experience. As a developer at Cast Iron Coding in Portland, OR, I built sites for clients, and trained and supported them in their ongoing use. As the Web Editor and Electronic Communications Manager at UC Berkeley’s BAMPFA I helped to build and maintain their digital presence, as well as coordinated with contractors, co-workers, and students to achieve complex strategic and technical communications goals. I have been out on my own since 2018, and am looking forward to helping you with your website.
